name: ST. PAUL FIRE AND MARINE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Edward ROCHE, Plenary Guardian of the Person and Estate of Diane Roche, an Incapacitated Person, and in his Own Right and William J. Scharfenberger, Trustee Allegheny Health, Education and Research Foundation and Allegheny University Hospitals, East, Including its Wholly Owned Operating Division, Allegheny University Hospital-Hahnemann Division and Lexington Insurance Company c/o Caronia Corporation and Medical Professional Liability Catastrophe Fund and Allegheny Health Services Providers Insurance Company, Ltd. and Continental Casualty Company and Steadfast Insurance Company, Appellees
name_abbreviation: St. Paul Fire & Marine Insurance v. Roche

judges: Justice LAMB did not participate in the consideration or decision of this ease.
parties: ST. PAUL FIRE AND MARINE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Edward ROCHE, Plenary Guardian of the Person and Estate of Diane Roche, an Incapacitated Person, and in his Own Right and William J. Scharfenberger, Trustee Allegheny Health, Education and Research Foundation and Allegheny University Hospitals, East, Including its Wholly Owned Operating Division, Allegheny University Hospital-Hahnemann Division and Lexington Insurance Company c/o Caronia Corporation and Medical Professional Liability Catastrophe Fund and Allegheny Health Services Providers Insurance Company, Ltd. and Continental Casualty Company and Steadfast Insurance Company, Appellees.

opinions.text:
REVISED ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 27th day of October, 2003, we affirm the Order of the Commonwealth Court.
Justice LAMB did not participate in the consideration or decision of this ease.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
857 A.2d 671
ST. PAUL FIRE AND MARINE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Edward ROCHE, Plenary Guardian of the Person and Estate of Diane Roche, an Incapacitated Person, and in his Own Right and William J. Scharfenberger, Trustee Allegheny Health, Education and Research Foundation and Allegheny University Hospitals, East, Including its Wholly Owned Operating Division, Allegheny University Hospital-Hahnemann Division and Lexington Insurance Company c/o Caronia Corporation and Medical Professional Liability Catastrophe Fund and Allegheny Health Services Providers Insurance Company, Ltd. and Continental Casualty Company and Steadfast Insurance Company, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 27, 2003.
